title: What is the meaning of the Gephelicus and Azir forms, and what is the significance of the talisman in astrology and Chaldean ritual?
first_phrase: This text delves into the mystical and esoteric meanings of various characters and concepts such as Gephelicus and Azir. The last 200 tokens focus on a talismanic ritual that involves reciting specific psalms and chants while facing different directions, depending on the position of the sun. The goal is to harness the power of the sun to strengthen qualities such as love, wisdom, and abundance. The text also mentions various correspondences between pagan, astrological, and Catholic beliefs. Overall, this is a text that explores the hidden meanings and influences behind spiritual practices.
content: Questa costellazione, detta casa del Sole, rappresenta il punto di elevazione massima solare all'orizzonte ed e' detta astrologicamente casa del Sole. Dai misteri e' indicata come la Porta d'oro della Citta' Santa. - Disegno del talismano - Sette cifre di Luce Amore prolificante Provvidenza Sapienza Giustizia Abbondanza Massima potenza in tutte le forme Salmi corrispondenti ebraizzanti: 1, 71, 110, 111, 112, 121 da recitarsi al sorgere, al passaggio sul meridiano, al tramonto, alla mezzanotte. - Salmo del rituale caldeo - Alzobar Amun vezok, vezok, vezok Betani sacraz Amru Alzobar Arnun, bni phaphne acoroaz Salin bni aphuti salicar agen - am Bni aphuti solome Adinar amaneth agabaz Royn bne sophta gengineraz Aphuti mono mono alzobar Amun Ra - Aphuti - Ea phaphne Caras oster√† nameni osten Ra aphuti - Ea phaphne Crisop catesfir gen Alzobar Amun acritoiz Benaphne, benaphne ocoriz Ben azen onomaz benaphne gen acaraz Alzobar Amun genir aphophte Alzobar Arnun genir aphophte Vazok, vazok, vazok. Questo canto si recita girando intorno a se', e voltando la faccia in tutti i sensi - sette volte al levar del sole, nove volte al sole meridiano, dodici al tramonto. Metallo appropriato oro.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the talisman described represents the highest point of solar elevation on the horizon and is astrologically known as the House of the Sun. Reciting the corresponding Psalms and performing the Chaldean ritual are essential steps in its creation. It is best made on parchment, washed in seawater at the exact time and day specified, and drawn facing south two days before a full moon. By following these instructions and incorporating the Sun's power and influence, one can develop active intellectual abilities and call upon the Solar Demon, Aaz, for guidance and strength in times of need.
